contributingGuidelines.excerpt:
Getting Involved
Code patches are not the only way to get involved: you can help the project by reporting bugs; improving docs; helping
others on GitHub Issues; tweeting to @metreeca; telling the world about
Metreeca ;-)
Reporting Bugs
Before opening an issue to report a bug, search open issues for similar cases
and, if something is found, just add any additional details in the comments.
If you've really found a new bug, creating a helpful report using the dedicated template will make fixing it much easier
and quicker.
If you just want some help with the framework or your project, start
a conversation and describe your problem.
Suggesting Features
If you think you have a good idea about improving or extending Metreeca/Link, feel free to open
an issues, using the dedicated template.
Again search open suggestions and, if something is found, just add any additional details in the comments.

description.excerpt: Metreeca/Link is a model-driven Java framework for rapid REST/JSON-LD backend development.
operations, faceted search, data validation and fine‑grained role‑based access control, relieving backend developers from
Metreeca/Link is server and storage-agnostic and may be easily connected to your solution of choice.
|    core | metreeca‑json | shape-based JSON modelling framework    |

|    data | metreeca‑xml | XML/HTML codecs and utilities           | 
|         | metreeca‑rdf | RDF codecs and utilities                |
A model-driven Java framework for rapid REST/JSON-LD backend development.

excerpt.body:
This is a **major** beta release introducing:

- localized data support, with `Accept-Language` content negotiation and idiomatic JSON serialization based on JSON-LD 
  language maps
- resource aliasing and coalescing based on `owl:sameAs` query-time reasoning
- overhauled and more efficient SPARQL-based model-driven engine



# Changed

- Lots of things :-(
- Overhauled `Field` shape API
- Simplified JSON-LD pagination/sorting parameters


# Added

- Support for `Link` shape and `owl:sameAs` reasoning
- Shape localization and `Accept-Language` content negotiation
- Support for result pagination in `Terms/Stats` queries
- Support for user-provided localized shapes in `Terms/Stats` responses 
- Standalone sample module `metreeca-toys` :-(
- Static content `Publisher` handler  
- `Scribe` code generation utilities


# Improved

- Extended `JSEServer` configuration API with `address()` and `context()` setters
- Upgraded to rdf4j 3.6.1


# Fixed

- `Router` handler now returns 404 for unknown resources
- `Udater` handler now delegates correct engine method
excerpt.name: v0.55.0

excerpt.body:
# Fixed

- Update license info in root pom.xml

This is a **major** beta release refocusing the framework to model-driven REST/JSON-LD API publishing.

# Changed

- Almost all :-(
- Switched to Apache 2.0 license

# Added

- Stem shape
- Lang/Localized shapes
- Compacted tagged literals in JSON-LD serialization
- Static content publishing handler

# Improved

- Simplified Engine API

# Fixed

- Prevented duplicate target matches in GraphEngine

This a major beta release introducing support for data processing actions and
 improved modularisation ;-(with the unfortunate side effect of widespread incompatible changes…)

# Changed

- reorganised modules
- migrated xml/rdf data format support to dedicated modules
- upgraded Storage service to java.nio.Path


# Added

- introduced support functional data processing pipelines

# Improved

- simplify Aliaser API: now lets thorough empty/idempotent redirects


# Fixed

- lots of minor glitches ;-)

This a major beta release focusing on API simplification and better separation of concerns ;-(with the unfortunate side effect of widespread incompatible changes…)

# New Features

- Simplified module structure and APIs

# Improvements

- JSON-LD-compatible idiomatic JSON RDF serialization, with customizable JSON-LD root context
- Simplified form-compatible faceted query syntax
- Payload-agnostic REST framework: RDF/SPARQL dependencies migrated to a dedicated backed adapter module
- Upgraded to RDF4J 3.0.0

This a beta release improving support for the development of user-facing applications.

;-(*) _breaking change: upgrade notes included…_


# New Feature

- `Aliaser` handler/wrapper redirects from aliases to canonical resource URLs
- Simplified form-based syntax supports easier basic queries on LDP containers
- `Connector.connect()` utility methods create graph-aware suppliers and functions


# Improvements

- ;-(*) Migrate `Router` to swagger-compatible path pattern syntax: now patterns must be specified as:

	| pattern | syntax |
    | :--- | :--- |
    | wildcard | `/{}` |
    | placeholder | `/{<key>}` (matched placeholders are made available as request parameters)|
    | prefix | `/*`|

- ;-(*) Remove default dependency from RDF4J Memory store: now project must include a maven dependency on the required graph backend and explicitly configure it on loading, e.g.:
    ```xml
    <dependency>
        <groupId>com.metreeca</groupId>
        <artifactId>rdf4j</artifactId>
        <version>0.51.0</version>
    </dependency>
    ```
    ```java
    @Override protected Handler load(final Tray tray) {
      return tray
        .set(graph(), RDF4JMemory::new)   
        .get(() -> new Server() … );
  }
	```
- ;-(*) Generalise role-based access control for SPARQL/Graphs endpoints: now public endpoint access is specified as:
	```java
	new SPARQL().query()
	```

# Bug Fixes

- Fix tray initialization in Gateway: now tools are initialized once on startup
- Fix management of local dependencies for Virtuoso: now the project compiles out of the box with `mvn clean install`

This a major beta release focusing on better support for the development of user-facing applications ;-(with the unfortunate side effect of a number of incompatible changes…)


# New Features

- Support for nested resource-related LDP container (e.g. `/products/*/orders/`)
- Support for multipart message bodies and file uploads
- Initial support for IAM services and single page app launching / session management in the `gate` module


# Improvements

- **;-(breaking changes)** Decouple storage backend providers to dedicated modules: now only required dependencies are included, greatly reducing apps footprint
-  **;-(breaking changes)** Simplified J2EE Gateway API: now applications entry points are just web filters and may be configured either using `@WebFilter` annotions or from `web.xml`
-  **;-(breaking changes)** Improved path patterns in `Router`: now supporting glob wildcards (`/*`) and prefix matching (`/**`)
- **;-(breaking changes)** Improved idiomatic RDF/JSON serialization: now compatible with ES6 destructuring
- Improved JSONWRiter/JSONParser IRI handling: now root relative paths are generated and accepted
- Improved JSON query parsing: now accepts `null` values for optional fields
- **;-(breaking changes)** Migrated location service API to factory methods
- Downgraded postprocessing generators to return `Collection<Statement>`
- Upgraded to RDF4J 2.5.0

This is a patch release addressing a blocking bug in shape validation.

# Bug Fixes

- Fix trace tool handling in ActorValidator: now is correctly propagated from parent validator.

This a beta release focusing on better interoperability with third-party SPARQL repositories; now automatically tested with [Ontotext GraphDB](https://www.ontotext.com/products/graphdb/), [Stardog](https://www.stardog.com) and [OpenLink Virtuoso](https://virtuoso.openlinksw.com).

Some further minor backward incompatible API changes…


# New Features

- Overhauled data validation engine compatible with snapshot transactions.
- Aggressive memoization of shape processing results.


# Improvements

- Improve validation reporting.
- Implement disjunctive filtering.
- Implement datatype filtering.
- Overhaul constant shape testing.
- Rename Format to Body to avoid clashes with RDF4J APIs.
- Further simplifications in the Redactor API.
- Further simplifications in the low-level engine APIs.
- Upgrade to RDF4J 2.4.5.


# Bug Fixes

- Fix handling of inverse fields in Outliner: now inverse fields generate direct statements in the outline.

This a major beta release focusing on API streamlining and rationalization ;-(with the unfortunate side effect of a number of incompatible changes…) and better LDP compliance.

# New Feature

- Simplified shape creation DSL and support APIs.
- Full support for model-driven LDP Basic/Direct Containers.
- Reusable model-driven authorization and content-throttling engine.
- Unified handling of pre/postprocessing filtering hooks.

# Improvements

- Restrict paths matched by wildcard patterns in Router: now only immediate child resources are matched.
- Upgrade to RDF4J 2.4.4.


# Bug Fixes

- Fix stray exception handling in Server: now unexpected runtime exceptions are not exposed to clients.

This is a minor release addressing some issues left over from the preliminary v0.47.0 initial public release.

# Improvements

- Extend and review documentation.
- Upgrade Creator.slug() to accept RDF4J Model.
- Add factory method for static RDF content filters in Processor.
- Add provisional support for container rdfs:label/comment metadata.

# Bug Fixes

- Fix broken dependency from local virtuoso library.
- Fix empty stats query results in Browser handler.
- Fix Router handler altering original request base/path.
- Expose missing Deleter.sync() method.
- Patch issue with rewritten Location headers in Processor.post().
This is a major release marking the initial public beta availability of metreeca/link.

support.excerpt:
- open an [issue](https://github.com/metreeca/link/issues) to report a problem or to suggest a new feature
- start a [conversation](https://github.com/metreeca/link/discussions) to ask a how-to question or to share an open-ended
  idea

usage.excerpt:
1. Add the framework to your Maven configuration

```xml
<project>

    <dependencyManagement>
        <dependencies>

            <dependency>
                <groupId>com.metreeca</groupId>
                <artifactId>metreeca-link</artifactId>
                <version>${link.version}</version>
                <type>pom</type>
                <scope>import</scope>
            </dependency>

        </dependencies>
    </dependencyManagement>

    <dependencies>

        <dependency> <!-- server connector -->
            <groupId>com.metreeca</groupId>
            <artifactId>metreeca-jse</artifactId>
        </dependency>

        <dependency> <!-- storage connector -->
            <groupId>com.metreeca</groupId>
            <artifactId>metreeca-rdf4j</artifactId>
        </dependency>

    </dependencies>

</project>
```

2. Write your first server and launch it

```java
import com.metreeca.jse.JSEServer;

import static com.metreeca.rest.Response.OK;
import static com.metreeca.rest.formats.TextFormat.text;

public final class Hello {

  public static void main(final String... args) {
    new JSEServer()

        .delegate(context -> request ->
            request.reply(response -> response
                .status(OK)
                .body(text(), "Hello world!")
            )
        )

        .start();
  }

}
```

3. Access you API

```shell
% curl -i http://localhost:8080/

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: text/plain
Content-Length: 12

Hello world!
```

4. Delve into the the [docs](https://metreeca.github.io/link/) to learn how to [publish](http://metreeca.github.io/link/tutorials/publishing-jsonld-apis) and [consume](https://metreeca.github.io/link/tutorials/consuming-jsonld-apis) your data as model-driven REST/JSON‑LD APIs…
